Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Izhar (יִצְהָר) descendant of Kohath (קֳהָת) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► opponent of Moses (מֹשֶׁה) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) ancestor of Korahite (קָרְחִי) clan

= the meaning of this word is uncertain and can only be deduced from its etymology; possible interpretations include: a song that shows understanding, by which the understanding either refers to the structure or to the contents of this song; or: a song that gives understanding; or: a meditation
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= indirect male progenitor

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
literally: hand; hence: = action by which humans or deities exert strength and power

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= causative action by which humans or deities take over the ownership of land from other humans, which usually implies that the former owners are driven away

= action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors

Node.gloss: to do harm (to someone)|to make suffer|to deal, treat harshly|to afflict
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities bring suffering or disaster upon a humans, often as the result of wrong behavior
= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language

Node.gloss: to release|to let go|to let loose|to set free
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans allow (other) humans or animals to move away freely from a place where they have been confined
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment
= action by which humans take ownership of land and other possessions

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power
= action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
literally: name; hence: = state in which someone acts with the authority of someone else
= action by which humans tread heavily and noisily on somebody or something; ► usually with the purpose of killing, destroying, desecrating, and/or humiliating
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
= person who experiences hostily towards someone else and acts accordingly

Node.gloss: to put to shame|to bring shame
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to forfeit the respect of the community, by provoking a situation that is not in accordance to that person's status
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= action by which humans express their pride and satisfaction about themselves, their actions, certain circumstances they find themselves in, or a deity that they consider responsible for those circumstances
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent
marker pointing out that the information that follows is an unexpected consequence of what has been stated before
= action by which someone makes a conscious decision to dismiss a certain object, person, or deity as inadequate, faulty, or otherwise unacceptable
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to experience a feeling of shame

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= relatively large group of people, usually with centralized leadership; ► assembled for a common purpose, such as warfare or a journey
literally: to cause (someone) to move back; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to stop advancing and move backwards instead

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
= person who experiences hostily towards someone else and acts accordingly

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= causative action by which deities cause a group of people to divide itself and move into various directions
= causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money
= a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live
= the amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= an individual, nation, or land that is affected by efforts from others to arouse an emotion of shame in them ◄ by words or actions
only used in poetry; = action by which humans express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures
= action by which someone speaks insulting words to someone else, ◄ out of a sense of superiority, ► intending to bring public shame upon that person
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
literally: shaking of the head; hence: = action by which humans turn their head from one side to the other ► to express scorn and derision

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
read בַּל־אֻמִּים as בַּלאֻמִּים among the nations
= a large body of people united by common descent
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done
= state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
literally: to cover (one's) face; hence: = process by which certain events happen with a great intensity and its results are visible in the recipient's facial expression

Node.gloss: to reproach|to taunt|to insult|to defy|to blaspheme
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions
= action by which a human being utters words that are intended to provoke shame in someone else
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

Node.gloss: to act falsely|to act treacherously|to deceive
Node.definition: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: to turn aside (from the right way); hence: = action by which humans deviate from what is considered to be the right way to conduct their lives

literally: the act or movement of putting one leg in front of the other in walking, used exclusively in a figurative way to denote part of one's journey through life; hence: = something that is being done and, when God is the agent, something that other people ought to do as well; at the same time one can easily slip and fall, which is a metaphor for failure
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: to crush; hence: = causative by which a deity inflicts deadly wounds on a individual or group ◄ as if crushing that person or those people with a heavy object

= animal looking like a longhaired dog with a pointed nose; yellowish brown in color with red tips to the fur on the back and a bushy tail; produces mournful sounds; ≈ used mainly in poetry and associated with death, destruction, and devastation, but also with mourning and weeping
literally: to cover; hence: = process by which certain events happen with a great intensity and are often more than the recipient can bear

literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= action by which humans or animals spread out part of their body

Node.gloss: to spread out one's hands > to pray
Node.definition: literally: to spread out or lift up one's palms; hence: = to present one's prayer and supplication before God by showing him one's empty hands
= generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= state in which an object is considered as not belonging to a certain group of objects
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to look for|to try out|to test|to search out|to explore|to investigate|to examine|to cross examine|to sound out|to determine
Node.definition: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= to hold the opinion that a particular object, person, or event is to be identified with, considered similar to, or to be equated with another object, person, or event

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= act of killing an animal by slicing the jugular vein and windpipe + with a sharp bladed instrument
= action by which someone ends a period of inactivity and comes into action, ◄ as if he had been sleeping for a certain time
= state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died
= action by which someone makes a conscious decision to dismiss a certain object, person, or deity as inadequate, faulty, or otherwise unacceptable
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

literally: to hide (one's) face (from someone); hence: = action by which a deity does not engage with people, and does not intervene neither in their favor nor to punish, ◄ as if he were enable to see them
literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves
= causative action by which humans cause hardship to other humans
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which an object is positioned around or against another object in such a way that the two cannot be separated easily

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= entire human body ◄ as a metonymic extension of the belly
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
